alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:51PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lafayette County through 315 PM CDT... At 250 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paris, or 7 miles south of Holly Springs National Forest, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Holly Springs National Forest, Denmark, Cambridge, Taylor, Altus, Keel, Burt, Yocona and College Hill Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
